A quetzal has bright green and red feathers.
A quokka is a small marsupial known for its cute smile.
A ram has large, curved horns.
A rattlesnake makes a rattling sound with its tail.
A raven is known for its black feathers and intelligence.
A ray glides smoothly through the water.
A rhea is a large bird that cannot fly.
A rhino has a thick horn on its nose.
A roadrunner can run very fast across the desert.
A robin sings beautiful songs in the spring.
A rottweiler is a large, protective dog.
A salamander lives both on land and in water.
A salmon swims upstream to lay eggs.
A sawfish has a long snout with sharp teeth.
A scorpion has a venomous sting in its tail.
A seahorse swims upright in the ocean.
A shrimp is a small sea creature with a hard shell.
A skunk sprays a strong smell to scare away danger.
A sloth moves very slowly in the trees.
A tamarin is a small monkey with a bushy tail.
A tanager is a colorful bird that lives in the forest.
A tang is a brightly colored fish that lives in coral reefs.
A tapir is a large animal with a long snout.
A tarantula is a large, hairy spider.
A termite can eat through wood very quickly.
A tern flies over the ocean to find fish.
A toad hops slowly on the ground.
A tortoise has a hard shell for protection.
A toucan has a large, colorful beak.
An umbrellabird has a long crest that looks like an umbrella.
An urchin has sharp spines to protect itself.
A viper is a venomous snake.
A vole is a small rodent that lives underground.
A vulture circles in the sky to find food.
A walrus has long tusks and lives in icy waters.
A warthog has large tusks and runs fast.
A wasp can sting to protect its nest.
A weasel is a small, quick animal that hunts for food.
A wildebeest migrates across the savannah.
A wolverine is strong and fierce.
A wombat digs burrows underground.
A woodpecker taps on trees to find insects.
A worm wriggles through the soil.
A xenops is a small bird that climbs trees.
A yak lives in cold mountain regions.
A yellowjacket can sting to protect its hive.
A zebrafish has stripes like a zebra.
